FuncDef:
The ipv6 import-route command enables IS-IS to import IPv6 routes from other protocols.
The undo ipv6 import-route command disables IS-IS from importing IPv6 routes from other protocols. The ipv6 import-route command enables IS-IS to import IPv6 routes from other protocols. The undo ipv6 import-route command disables IS-IS from importing IPv6 routes from other protocols. By default, IS-IS does not import IPv6 routes from other protocols. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ipv6 import-route { direct | static | { ospfv3 | ripng | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp [ permit-ibgp ] } [ cost <cost> | tag <tag> | { route-policy <route-policy-name> } | [ level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 ] ]
ipv6 import-route { { ospfv3 | ripng | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp [ permit-ibgp ] | direct } inherit-cost [ { level-1 | level-2 | level-1-2 } | tag <tag> | route-policy <route-policy-name> ]
undo ipv6 import-route { direct | static | { ospfv3 | ripng | isis } [ <process-id> ] | bgp }

ParaDef.Info:
Imports IS-IS routes.Before you specify this parameter, enable an IS-IS process with a.
process-id different from the local one.
-

Specifies the process ID of the imported protocol.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 1.

Imports IBGP routes in a public network instance.
If you do not specify permit-ibgp, the device imports EBGP routes only.
-

Specifies a cost for the imported route.
The value ranges from 0 to 4261412864, regardless of cost types.

Assigns administrative tags to the imported routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of a route-policy.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Imports routes to the Level-1 routing table.
-

Imports routes to the Level-2 routing table.
-

Imports routes to Level-1 and Level-2 routing tables.
If no level is specified in the command, routes are imported to the Level-2 routing table by default.
-

Retains the original cost of the imported route. If this parameter is specified, you cannot configure the cost and cost type for the routes imported by IS-IS.
-

ExtraInfo: When IS-IS and other routing protocols are deployed on a network, you can enable the traffic within an IS-IS domain to reach a destination outside the IS-IS domain using either of the following methods:
